title: [Large-Scale] Social Constructivist Collaborative Learning Design for Chemical Engineering Solid-State Process Education: Language-Integrated Approach (Utilizing Professional Discourse and Technical Texts)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic chemical engineering theory and industrial field experience, comprehension of engineering-specific terminology and technical documentation skills, foundational understanding of academic discourse structures.
context.additional_context: A course focusing on learners who will perform teaching roles acquiring instructional methods applicable to real educational settings. Particularly emphasizes instructional design reflecting engineering field-specific discourse (academic discussions, technical document writing) and academic writing requirements (report structure, specialized vocabulary usage).

learning_goals: Learners will explain solid particle characterization and process design principles using chemical engineering terminology and academic discourse structures and apply them to technical documents/report text types.

Learners will collaboratively develop chemical engineering solid operation education scenarios with peer teachers and utilize effective communication strategies (academic discussions, presentations, feedback) in academic discourse communities.

Learners design educational modules utilizing social constructivist-based pedagogical approaches (academic discussions, case study presentations, feedback cycles) and develop instructional materials that reflect disciplinary discourse characteristics (technical text structures, academic vocabulary usage).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
